metadata.title: CVE-2023-35838 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: The WireGuard client 0.5.3 on Windows insecurely configures the operatingsystem and firewall such that traffic to a local network that usesnon-RFC1918 IP addresses is blocked. This allows an adversary to trick thevictim into blocking IP traffic to selected IP addresses and services evenwhile the VPN is enabled. NOTE: the tunnelcrack.mathyvanhoef.com websiteuses this CVE ID to refer more generally to "LocalNet attack resulting inthe blocking of traffic" rather than to only WireGuard.

criterions.comment: wireguard: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
